case_vignette: A 24-year-old Caucasian woman presented with intermittent, inflammatory papulopustules and nodules on the face, neck, chest, and back! The lesions would appear 1 week premenstrually and resolve 1 week postmenstrually with normal menstrual cycles! She has a history of adolescent acne that is only responsive to isotretinoin 6 years ago! Examination revealed scarring and postinflammatory hyperpigmentation diffusely on her face!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Premenstrual acne flare or hormonal acne

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have been experiencing outbreaks of red bumps and pus-filled bumps on my face, neck, chest, and back that appear before my menstrual period and go away after it ends.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms each month before my menstrual period.
Do the outbreaks leave any scars or dark spots after they heal?
Yes, the outbreaks leave scars and dark spots on my face.
Have you used any treatments or medications for your symptoms so far?
Yes, I've previously taken isotretinoin when I was a teenager for acne and it helped back then.
Do you have any known hormonal imbalances or conditions such as PCOS (Polycystic Ovary Syndrome)?
No, I have normal menstrual cycles.
Final Diagnosis: Premenstrual Acne

I've been having red bumps and painful lumps appearing on my face, neck, chest, and back before my period that go away after my period ends.

The symptoms have been occurring around my menstrual cycle each month.

No, my menstrual cycles are normal.

No, I'm not currently taking any medications or supplements.

Final Diagnosis: Acne Vulgaris
